column1: Effects of Preconceptional Ethanol Consumption on ADHD-Like Symptoms in Sprague-Dawley Rat Offsprings.|Choi et al.
column3: 2012|Ethanol exposure during gestational period is related to growth retardation
column5: and even in neurological abnormalities including attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)-like behaviors on offspring. However
column6: relatively little is known about the effects of maternal ethanol consumption prior to conception on their offspring. In this study
column7: we investi-gated whether maternal ethanol administration during preconceptional phase produces ADHD-like behaviors in the rat offspring.|DECEMBER 10

column1: Chronic exposure to ethanol of male mice before mating produces attention deficit hyperactivity disorder-like phenotype along with epigenetic dysregulation of dopamine transporter expression in mouse offspring.|Kim et al.
column2: (2014-5) J. Neuro Res. 2014|Preconception exposure to EtOH through the paternal route may affect neurobehavioral and developmental features of offspring. This study investigates the effects of paternal exposure to EtOH before conception on the hyperactivity
column4: and impulsivity behavior of male offspring in mice. Sire mice were treated with EtOH in a concentration range approximating human binge drinking (0â€“4 g/kg/day EtOH) for 7 weeks and mated with untreated females mice to produce offspring.|DECEMBER 10
